Chapter on Scattering Seeds, Chapter 1: From the rising of the victorious sun, the image also has complexion and conduct, virtue is abundant, in the midst of abundance, noble, of revered clan and virtuous conduct, originally from this kind, in the world and also in the heavens, all join palms in reverence to the Buddha, therefore holding the head and face as a prostration.
The Buddha is unsurpassed, there is none equal in diligence in the world, ghosts, dragons, gods, and humans are also within the three realms.
Approaching the subtle, those not liberated are liberated, the dead do not die again, the aged do not age again, all attain the Buddha Dharma from practice;
Also the practitioner is within the three without practice and also virtue is guarded.
Listen to the true Dharma spoken, create with one's own mind, the practitioner attains flavor, like pressing sugarcane, always fearfully observing.
Accumulating over a hundred, if one does not attain joy, one will be exhausted by old age and death, and thus be submerged in the world.
It is like an elephant without strength, falling into a pit and unable to extricate itself.
People in the world are also like this, taking comfort from various kinds of scriptures.
It is like a pile of various kinds of flowers, wishing to create and practice the stage of the path.
Listen, if you wish to cross over and speak of liberation, the practitioner should listen and explain the stage of practicing the path.
Birth, old age, sickness, death, worry, sorrow, if unpleasant, anxiety;
The practitioner, whether practicing at home or abandoning the home life;
Those who wish to destroy the root of suffering, those who wish to go and attain the path;
There is no other close [relative], no other refuge, no other able to understand and abide, one should abandon everything.
In this way, the practitioner should only abandon everything, causing the stage of practicing the path to come later.

Speaking of birth, old age, sickness, death, attachment, intention, and worry, then the body produces suffering. Those who wish to transcend the world should practice the stages of the path and not be weary in the body.
Having already aged, become sick and died, from this if one is attached to intentional vexation, one should follow and accept the Buddha's precepts, and then practice to attain the unconditioned.
What is meant by unpracticed?ğŸ”½What is meant by practiced?

From this, the body is thought of, the thought of form is always thought of as pure;
Judging one's own body as lacking wisdom, living in a prefecture or county, and living together with the weak;
Thinking of form as dim, not free from greed;
Much desire, much anger, much delusion, many conditions, much food;

Abandoning practice, lust for the body, sleepiness, forgetful mind, doubting faults, diligently losing diligence, fearing not controlling the faculties, many affairs, much speaking, much work, much doing;
Long inverted teaching, inverted intention calculation.
This is also like this, the present world's dharmas either follow the path or leave the path, this is called what cannot be practiced.

Because of leaving the unconditioned, from the later binding teachings, anger, wanting to kill, always body pleasure purity receiving thought, not wise not following, from various evils, the Buddha says this is not possible to practice.
What is possible to practice?
Remembering to come out, not remembering anger, not remembering killing, being close to bright friends, upholding pure precepts, not having many meals;
Asking about one's own body, not thinking of this, not thinking of what is not good;
Remembering suffering, remembering impurity, not remembering the body's goodness;
Not living in the countryside, not living with weak people;

Guarding oneself, having few troubles, few affairs, and little food;
Not abandoning skillful means;
Subduing the body, abandoning sleep, the mind dwelling in practice, guarding the mind without doubt;
Vigorously practicing, being free from fear, and controlling the sense faculties;
Speaking little, dwelling in the truth, practicing and receiving the teachings of the truth, cultivating the mind of truth, delighting in empty marshes, practicing as if contemplating existence.
Not yet obtaining the good Dharma, one should attain the Dharma; having attained it, one should protect it;
Delighting in hearing the sutras, using one's body as sufficient, but not being content with the Dharma, practicing with the knowledge of impermanence;
Not delighting in worldly virtues, being disgusted with food and able to be without affairs, also practicing in this way, following the Dharma to attain non-action.
This is called what should be practiced.
What is meant by what should be practiced?
From this one attains non-action. Later, the precepts are bound and explained, falling into faith and not thinking of the body, collecting and receiving the Dharma affairs.
The listener sees clearly, not invading various things, this corresponds to non-action.

Those who attain the Way, the Buddha speaks of the Dharma with various kinds of intentions, there is no suffering, no fatigue, he has already spoken of the accumulation of merits, gathering the faculties and subduing the body should be practiced.
What kind of intentions does the practitioner have, how should he serve and practice as appropriate?
The practitioner practices, the practitioner closely practices, this is the practice and cultivation.
This practitioner has three levels:
Those who have not yet attained the Way, those in training, and those beyond training.
What is the stage of the Way?
What the practitioner practices is the stage of the practitioner.
What is it for those who have not yet attained the Way?
The initial arising and subsequent practice, dwelling in front, is said to be the practice.
Having spoken like this, those in training and those beyond training have also been spoken of.
The stage of the Way is called tranquility and contemplation.
What is the use of this tranquility and contemplation?
But because the four virtues have not yet been attained, one wishes to attain these four virtues;
What is the use of wishing to attain these four virtues?
Because of this, one wishes to attain the unconditioned.
What is the cause and condition for attaining the unconditioned?
It is because one does not wish to leave any remainder.
Why does one not wish to leave any remainder?
It is only because one wishes to eliminate all suffering.
Therefore, practitioners who wish to eliminate all suffering should always be inseparable, unviolated, and unpermeable, establishing stillness and contemplation.
If practitioners are permeable, they will not attain stillness, nor will they attain contemplation, and their practice of emptiness will be lost.

It is like a person seeking fire who drills wood, drilling the upper wood into the lower wood, sometimes stopping, sometimes drilling. In this way, they have never obtained fire, but only tire themselves out.
The Way is like this. It will be explained later:
If practitioners of the contemplation of dharmas become tired and weary, they should rest their practice. Do not be permeable or tired. Those who rest from practice will lose their practice.
It is like a person walking in pitch darkness at night with their eyes closed. When will they see the light?

If a practitioner's practice is not penetrating, a wise one is like this. When the sun rises and the eyes are opened, the practice gradually becomes wise. A person attains the seeds of the unconditioned, and the sutra expounds various sutras. One who thoroughly understands the sutras observes the teachings in the sutras, and then explains the still observation. Other sutras explain it in a scattered manner.
This is the chapter on the scattered seeds of the stages of the path.

The chapter on the wisdom of understanding the five aggregates, the Sutra of the Stages of the Path, the second chapter on the wisdom of understanding the five aggregates, obtained from various sutras, illuminating firmness, not aging or dying, the nectar, the fame and renown of practice like the bright moon, the pure one, the wise one, the one who guards the precepts, the one who illuminates further, and the practice at home is also like this!
Evil intentions cannot be entangled, cannot be pulled like a rope.
Therefore, giving to those who have attained the Way, paying homage to those who have attained the Way, bowing to them because one has obtained the nectar.
Greed is the seed, multiplicity is the birth, and the joy of affection is the branch of sorrow.
The Buddha said the five aggregates are like a lute, listening to the explanation from the many sutras pulling the practitioner along the path.
You should know that the body is originally composed of five kinds: form, sensation, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

Just as there are so many households in the east, so many households in the south, so many households in the west, and so many households in the north, it is not a single house that is called a village.
This is an analogy for form. It is not a single form that is called form, but many forms are called form.
Sensation, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are also like this.

Form is in the ten sense bases, and the text also follows the Dharma. Sensation is called form, the one hundred and eight sensations are called sensation, the one hundred and eight thoughts are called perception, the one hundred and eight actions are called mental formations, and the one hundred and eight consciousnesses are called consciousness. In this way, you should know that the five kinds appear later.
The analogy is not connected, but only because of original delusion;
Not hearing the Buddha's words, or because of habitual delusion.
It is like a tree leaf attached to a branch. Foolish evil actions attach to the five kinds and form the five aggregates. The mind calculates this to be the body.
The chapter on the knowledge of the five aggregates in the stages of the path.

The chapter on the complete characteristics corresponding to the stages of the path, the third chapter. The nature river opens and fills the vessel, fills and breaks the six-part sutra, honey, suddenly like a lotus flower opening, the sun of wisdom appears, wearing the supreme lotus flower to serve the Buddha, pure and simple, its appearance is like this.
The most revered one in the world, the one with blessings and virtue, looking at his essence and firmness, the one who will take the path, expounds it as in the sutra.

Having already opened and transformed the practitioner of the path, one should also know the five kinds each corresponding to their characteristics, the characteristics of the type and color, the characteristics of the appearance also have color, the characteristics of the hand and the grip also have color;
The characteristics of feeling are for pain, pleasure, and neither pleasure nor pain, which are the characteristics of pain;
The characteristics of consciousness are thoughts, whether of a woman, a man, or others, which are thoughts;
What is done is called action, whether good action, bad action, neither good nor bad action, this is the characteristic of action;
The characteristic of consciousness is consciousness, whether good, bad, neither good nor bad consciousness, this is the characteristic of consciousness.
Thus these five kinds each have their own characteristics.
From the latter explanation, it is said that this form is also mostly evil in pleasure, as explained in the sutras by the Buddha, explaining as appropriate the characteristics of the five aggregates.
The stages of the path are fully explained according to the characteristics.

Chapter on the Distinct Manifestation and Cessation of the Five Aggregates, Chapter 4 of the Path of Stages Sutra. The five aggregates are like fuel, the nectar of upholding the seeds is sprinkled on the five aggregates, using the wisdom fire to destroy the evil fire.

From the three realms, I pay homage to the one who bestows homage, for the one who holds the nectar and extinguishes the three poisons, from the five aggregates, the one who gives rise to what is appropriate, holds the mind of wisdom and extinguishes the evil mind of fire, the one who is respected in the three realms, I also respect with joined palms.
From the power of wisdom and knowledge, the wise one attains by oneself, as if knowing by oneself, the Buddha then teaches the disciples what should be practiced.

Listen to the explanation of the concentration of the mind from this, the discernment of the five aggregates, for the one who is guarded by the power of wisdom, knows the pure self-Buddha, from the mind that knows, the one who manifests the matter, this is what the Buddha says should be practiced, the view and practice can be known.
Listen to the explanation of the mind from this concentration, the discernment of the five aggregates.ğŸ”½The practitioner should know the discernment of the five aggregates.
How should the practitioner discern and know the five aggregates?

It is like a pearl worth a thousand pieces of gold falling in the middle of a crossroads. A person sees it, and upon seeing it, they are delighted and love it, wishing to obtain the pearl. The person's mind is on the pearl, this is the type of form aggregate;
What is delightful and agreeable is the type of sensation aggregate;
If it is named as such at the top, this is the type of perception aggregate;
If the mind wishes to take the pearl, this is the type of formation aggregate;
From this, it is known to be the type of consciousness aggregate.

In this way, the five types of mind are together in one pearl, and they function together, also functioning by themselves. In this way, in one pearl, the five aggregates function together at the same time. The same is true for the other sense objects.

The five aggregates that arise together with the form seen by the eyes, and the five aggregates that arise together with the sound heard by the ears, the smell perceived by the nose, the taste perceived by the mouth, and the coarse and fine sensations perceived by the body, the four aggregates in the body do not have the type of form that arises. In this way, the five aggregates of each type are individually cognized.

Later, there were those who spoke of the Way and virtue, distinguishing and explaining in this way. Having attained this sutra's explanation, those who have not yet attained the Way accept it with an attached mind. The mind acts in this way and speaks. I also manifest this explanation.
The chapter on the manifestation of the cessation of the discrimination of the five aggregates on the path of practice.

The chapter on the five kinds of success and failure in the Daoxing jing, the fifth chapter on the five kinds of success and failure. Having already understood the essentials, one attains Buddhahood. The essentials are completed, the essentials are accomplished, the essentials are attained together, the essentials are already completed together, and there are no further essentials. One should bow in response, without attachment. The fame and renown are immeasurable, and the words spoken.

It is like the bright moonlight, illuminating for the disciples to understand. Fearing the brain-like offenses that arise and can destroy the trunk, having already understood the five aggregates and attained illumination, the success and failure are as they are, one should bow one's head and listen.
The Buddha said:
Practitioners should know the success and failure of the five aggregates coming in and out.
It is like a person whose life is about to end, breathing in and out, about to die, with the four hundred and four diseases arising in sequence;
Then they see fearful thoughts arise, in dreams they see bees pecking at trees, crows pecking at their heads.
On a one-pillar tower, they happily see themselves wearing clothes, blue, yellow, red, and white, and themselves wearing them, seeing people riding horses, with the sound of sheep.
Holding a pillow made of straw, lying down in a pile of dirt.
The dead also carry the dead, and also remove filth, eating from the same vessel;
Also seeing this person together riding a cart, sesame oil and mud staining the feet and also smearing the body;
Also seeing this person drinking from time to time;
Also seeing falling into a net, being dragged away by hunters.
Or seeing oneself laughing happily, crying happily;
Or seeing a path with tadpoles passing over;
Or seeing salt money being collected;
Or seeing a woman with disheveled hair and naked, pulling oneself;
Some have ashes smeared on the body and also eat;
Or seeing dogs and monkeys chasing each other in fear;
Or seeing oneself about to marry.ğŸ”½Sometimes seeing the household deity destroyed;
Sometimes seeing a horse come and trample on one's beard and hair;
Sometimes seeing teeth fall out;ğŸ”½Sometimes seeing a corpse-bearer's clothes put on one's own body;
Sometimes seeing oneself naked and smeared with grease;
Sometimes seeing a mound of earth turn into oneself;
Sometimes seeing oneself walking in leather and felt clothes;
Sometimes seeing at home, the door is dilapidated, and a cart comes loaded with oil, flowers, and incense.
Also seeing brothers and sisters near oneself, the ancestors' people appear with a rough and fearful complexion, wanting to come and take this taken one to go together.
Sometimes walking in the cemetery, suddenly discarding the flowers on one's neck;
Sometimes seeing oneself fall into the water in a river;
Sometimes seeing oneself fall into the five lakes and nine rivers without reaching the bottom;
Sometimes seeing oneself enter a reed and rush, naked and cutting each other to spread and turn.
Sometimes climbing a tree, there are no fruits, no flowers, and no flower games;
Sometimes dancing on an altar;
Sometimes walking alone in the trees, greatly enjoying the beauty, also holding various tree trunks and breaking the firewood pile;
Sometimes entering a house, dark and unable to find the door out;
Sometimes climbing a mountain, crying out in grief;
Sometimes a bird pecks at the feet and also steps on them;
Sometimes the head is covered in dust;

Sometimes blocked by a tiger, also by a dog, a monkey, and a donkey, going south and entering a charnel ground, seeing a pile of charcoal, hair, feathers, bones crushed to pieces, and tree flowers, seeing oneself entering the salt king.
Seeing the salt king's envoy asking, later manifested and said:

'Having already obtained much pleasure in the world, the faculties fall or the body falls, fearing that life is about to depart, unable to be free, illness chases and urges, having already been urged, the mind then moves, life ends, and worries approach, then seeing dreams causing one to enter great fear.'
The person then thinks in the mind:
'My life is about to end, I have had such a dream, and my body has seen it.
' Then, frightened, my body became emaciated.
It is like a bird stepping on a post, its body close, extremely painful, then wanting to take refuge in a doctor.
My relatives and siblings, seeing the severity of my illness, immediately sent a messenger to the doctor's house.
When the messenger went, there were these signs: unclean and evil clothes, long nails, disheveled beard and hair, riding a broken-down cart, wearing tattered and worn-out shoes;
with a dark complexion and blue eyes, driving white oxen and horses in the cart, and with his own hands grooming his beard and hair.
After calling the doctor, he urgently drove the cart to go up, binding him from behind.

But sitting in evil and joyful thoughts, not considering good and joyful things, not thinking of the doctor's illness, his body already ruined, he immediately fell into a vessel of sin, and then sent for the doctor, who thought:
'The pain cannot be revived.
Why is it so?
The appearance of the person who is to be cured has such a form, with clothing, speech, carriage, beard, hair, and robes;

it is also like this. If the taboo day comes, whether it is the fourth, sixth, ninth, twelfth, or fourteenth, it comes to this, and again touches the taboo day, which people dislike. What blood taboo is above the appearance of the four branches?
This is also not necessarily the time, hour, or stars.
In an instant, people doubt and take appearances.
Why is this?

Sometimes it is an evil time, hour, or star, but there are people who use skillful means to cure illnesses. Sometimes illnesses cannot be cured. Therefore, it is not necessarily in the time, day, or hour.
Therefore, the wise do not rejoice in using the calendar.
The sages always encourage:
One should seek skillful means to cure, up to death or illness. If there is a sudden illness, it can be cured. If the life is exhausted, just say to leave.
Calculating like this, it is possible to reach the house of illness and pain, and then tie it up;
Saying they all enter the sea, some reach it and some perish in the middle. Illness is also comparable to the sea, some are cured and some die.

The doctor then went to the house of illness and pain, and heard voices that were unpleasant, such as destroy, burn, break, pierce, scrape, brush, come out, kill, go, extinguish, corrode, destroy, burn, break, pierce, scrape, brush, come out, kill, go, extinguish, corrode that were incurable and already dead. Looking to the south, he saw a crow and owl nest with a sound;
He also saw children together smearing each other with dirt;
Also seeing naked people pulling each other's hair, breaking jars, basins, tiles, and bowls;
Also seeing empty vessels and houses without any intention.
Going to the house of the sick person, entering and seeing the sick person, the illness becomes more troublesome.
From that house, the doctor then looked at the illness, and the signs of urgency, fear, fright, sitting up, and the sick person having no strength and being unable to be independent.
Seeing this, he thought:

The sutra says that when one sees the signs of death, one's complexion is not as usual, the skin wrinkles, the body becomes ashen, the tongue hangs out, one may forget words, one's body feels heavy and the joints do not move, the nose becomes crooked and the skin turns black, the throat and tongue become ashen and one loses the sense of taste.

The mouth becomes dry, the pores turn red, the muscles and veins become unclear, the hair stands on end, one does not feel when the hair is pulled, one stares straight ahead and lies on one's back, one's complexion changes in fright, the face wrinkles, the hair stands on end, one looks around with wide eyes, or speaks incoherently.
As the sutra says:
One's remaining life is insufficient, like a tree caught in a fire, or like the six characteristics, without speaking of what is heard or seen.
If one bathes the body before it is bathed, it is like the fragrance of sandalwood;
sometimes it is like the fragrance of honey;ğŸ”½sometimes it is a fragrance with many seeds;
sometimes it is a fragrance of natti;ğŸ”½sometimes it is a fragrance of roots;ğŸ”½sometimes it is a fragrance of bark;
sometimes it is a fragrance of flowers;
sometimes the smell of fruit;
sometimes the smell of incense;
sometimes the smell of one's past karma, such as the smell of sinews, hair, bones, flesh, blood, and excrement;ğŸ”½sometimes the smell of a vulture;
sometimes the smell of a crow;ğŸ”½sometimes the smell of a viper;
sometimes the smell of a pig;ğŸ”½sometimes the smell of a dog;
sometimes the smell of an otter;ğŸ”½sometimes the smell of a rat;
sometimes the smell of a snake;
sometimes it is like a person.ğŸ”½sometimes the sound of a woodpecker;
sometimes the sound of pottery;ğŸ”½sometimes a rough sound;
sometimes an unpleasant sound;ğŸ”½sometimes the sound of a goose;
sometimes the sound of a peacock;
sometimes the sound of a drum;ğŸ”½sometimes the sound of a horse;
sometimes the sound of a tiger.

There are also those who say that in the signs of death from illness, it is like when a person is dying, there are signs of death, such as the mouth not knowing the taste, the ears not hearing sounds, everything contracts, the veins shoot blood into the flesh, the cheeks swell, the head shakes, the eyes lose their luster, the buttocks protrude, the eyes turn black, the feces and urine do not pass, the joints loosen, and the mouth drools.
Such signs of illness are incurable, even if all the good doctors and priests gather, they cannot cure it.
The doctor then thought:
This illness is life-threatening and should be avoided.
He then told the family members:
Whatever the patient desires, give it to them without restriction. There is a small matter in my family, and I will leave after it is finished.
He whispered to the patient's family:
There is no cure.
Having told them, he left.
Having heard the doctor's words, the sick person immediately abandons the medicine and stops the treatment.

Relatives, friends, and neighbors gather together, surround the sick person, and weep sorrowfully, just like cows being slaughtered by butchers. The remaining cows see the dead cow and fear for themselves. They run and hide in the mountains and forests, crying out in fear.
It is also like pigs being slaughtered by butchers. The remaining pigs are frightened and terrified by the killing. They raise their ears and stare straight ahead.
It is also like fish caught in a net by fishermen. The remaining fish are frightened and terrified by the sight. They sink and hide in the sand and rocks, among the seaweed.
It is also like a flock of flying birds. When one bird is caught by a hawk, the remaining birds are frightened and scatter in all directions.

In this way, brothers, relatives, acquaintances, neighbors, and so forth, seeing the pitiful separation and life about to end, the messengers of hell have already arrived and are about to enter the prison. In this place, they immediately turn to death, the arrow has already shot, and the rope of birth and death acts, pulling them to pass through the world.

Relatives have already gathered the hair and grass, if the sound of sighing fills the mouth and does not stop, expressing grief and seeing what is loved, various kinds of tears and snot come out, calling out What to do!
The sick one will not recover for a long time. Internally, one sees a wind arise called the knife wind, causing the sick person's joints to loosen;
Again, a wind arises called the sudden wind, causing the sick person's knots to break;ğŸ”½Again, a wind arises called the needle wind, causing the sick person's tendons to slacken;
Again, a wind arises called the bone-breaking wind, causing the sick person's bones and marrow to be injured;
Again, a wind arises called the hidden wind, causing the sick person's eyes, ears, and nose to all turn blue, and the hair and pores to be destroyed and pulled out from all the holes.

There is another wind called upward wind, which causes the patient's internal body, knees, ribs, shoulders, back, chest, abdomen, navel, small intestine, large intestine, liver, lungs, heart, spleen, kidneys, and other organs to be cut off;
There is another wind called accomplishing wind, which causes the patient's blue blood, fat, grease, feces, urine, heat and cold, and roughness to dry up and leave.

There is another wind called joint-dwelling wind, which causes the patient's bones and joints to be straightened and shaken, sometimes raising their hands and feet, sometimes grasping empty space, sometimes standing up, sometimes sitting, sometimes groaning, sometimes crying, sometimes frowning.

Having scattered the joints, having severed the knots, having loosened the tendons, having injured the bone marrow, having lost the essence and clarity, only the remaining body is left, the mind has already become cold like wood, having abandoned the five elements, and the heart is weak, only a little bit remains.

It is like the remaining light when a lamp is extinguished. If one's thoughts are not yet extinguished, there is only a subtle intention. Consciousness is the basis of a person's past good and evil deeds, and the mind then sees.
If one has good thoughts in this life, one is happy. If one does evil, one immediately feels ashamed.
If one obtains a good rebirth, one's mind is happy. If one falls into an evil realm, one's mind is immediately sorrowful and ashamed.

It is like a person looking into a clear mirror and seeing all the images of their face, with white hair, wrinkled skin, bodily impurities, missing teeth, or dirty teeth. Seeing the body's aging, one immediately feels ashamed. Closing one's eyes and putting away the mirror, one does not want to see, because putting away the mirror brings sorrow. My youth is gone, old age has arrived, and my complexion is ugly. Happiness is gone.
In the same way, if one has habitually done evil, following evil deeds, one then feels sorrowful and remorseful, suffering unbearably, blaming oneself:
Now I have undoubtedly fallen into an evil realm.

If one practices as taught, practicing the three good deeds, observing the precepts, and fulfilling one's vows, the best practitioner will have much goodness, and will immediately be joyful and delighted, thinking to himself:
Now I am going to heaven, which is also a good place.
It is like a merchant who escapes from a difficult path and returns home to his family with much profit, feeling joyful;
It is also like a farmer who wishes to harvest the five grains and store them in his house;
It is also like a sick person who recovers and feels at ease;
It is also like one who has paid off his debts;
The practice of good deeds is also like this, combining good practices;
It is like a bee thinking joyfully, I have arrived at a good place.

Immediately, the consciousness of the body ceases, and in the middle there is a form, like a scale tipping up and down, thus abandoning death and receiving birth, like planting rice and the roots growing in pairs.

In this way, when the consciousness ceases in the middle, the five aggregates are immediately born in the middle, complete and not lacking. The aggregates at death also do not obtain the five aggregates in the middle, and they do not depart from the five aggregates at death, but there are the five aggregates in the middle.
There is only the five aggregates at death, so the five aggregates in the middle are born.

It is like a person holding a seal, and the seal is impressed on good clay, and in the clay there is the seal, but the seal also does not go to the clay, and the clay also does not depart from the seal.
It is like a seed giving rise to roots, and the seed is not the roots, and the roots are also not apart from the seed;
The spirit of a person is also like this, small and large according to the Dharma, from birth going to the middle, from this originally there is existence.

One who practices well obtains good five aggregates in the middle, and one who practices evil obtains evil in the middle. One who obtains the aggregates observes with the heavenly eye. One who abides in the middle has three foods:
Joy, thought, and consciousness.
One who abides in the middle may stay for one day, or stay for seven days, staying until the parents meet, and also where one is to fall, one stays in the middle from there.
When one is about to fall into the place of rebirth and die, having already been born in the intermediate state, one immediately gives rise to a thousand thoughts, or sees and is born in delusion.
Those of the most evil conduct will naturally be by a great fire;
there will also be several hundred thousand crows, ravens, and hawks gathering together;

one will also see people with evil claws, faces, teeth, and attire, with their heads on fire, and with various kinds of poison in their hands. One will see oneself far away in a dense forest, and will then give rise to the intention to enter it. The intermediate state will then cease, and one will be born in the place of rebirth. One will then soon see a sword-leaf tree fall into it. This is called hell.
The five aggregates, six sense bases, and ten karmic paths, all evil conduct, will then see violent smoke, dust, fire, wind, and rain come and touch the body;
one will also see elephants, lions, tigers, and vipers fearing for one's own body;
one will also see pits and wells closing up behind one, and also stopping at steep cliffs.

Giving rise to the intention to enter, one will then abandon the body of the intermediate state. Having given rise to the intention, one will immediately cease the intermediate state and be born in the place of rebirth. One will then soon reach the animal realm.

Later, they become extremely foolish and have no manners. They hold evil intentions towards their parents and always delight in coarse words, anger, binding, beating, and doing evil. Such people who do not give what is not to be given will fall into the animal realm.

The light sins diminish and then give rise to hot winds. Life is tormented by hunger and the body is pierced by swords and spears. Returning to the human realm, one also sees a great pit, intending to enter it.

This is the intermediate state of existence that is born from the mind. It then perishes and receives the intermediate state of existence of the realm into which one will fall. One then immediately falls into the realm of hungry ghosts. This is called becoming a hungry ghost.ğŸ”½From existence, it is said that one engages in two contemptible and deceitful acts. One also slanders and violates the precepts and falsely discusses. One eats everything without avoiding evil and impurity. One does not return to practice the Dharma and speaks falsely. One then falls into the mud of blood and saliva. This is called falling into the realm of hungry ghosts.
Here is the corrected and aligned text:
